data.title: Fast Delivery
data.text: We order from Thai Flavors all the time. They deliver to my work downtown. The food comes very quickly usually within minutes and is hot. Be careful on what spice level you want. They have been very accommodating when I ask for special ways to cook things. I like to have no oil and just steamed veggies. They get it right!

data.title: An Off Day?
data.text: This place came highly recommended by local friends, but was something of a let-down for me. My friends ordered a curry (good) and a ginger (also good, but overly spiced) while I had chicken satay and spring rolls.  The satay was dry and the peanut sauce run of the mill; the spring rolls weren't fresh and the sauces overly sweet.

data.title: Pad thai!
data.text:
We love the pad thai here. Chicken larb is another go to dish for us. 

Service is always on point. Quick turn around time for food. Pleasant, tranquil atmosphere. Prices are less than in the suburbs- bonus!

data.title: Vegetarian granddaughter was delighted with the choices
data.text: Party of six, all enjoyed the food chosen. Portions generous, service quick and attentive. The decor is lovely though the exterior is unassuming.

data.title: Excellent for delivery, but not the best Thai place in town
data.text: I love that they offer delivery. Their Tom Yum Soup is not my favorite, but it is still delicious. Their Angry Dish is definitely the best in town. I prefer things spicy, and they do a great job making it really really spicy. Their delivery times are accurate, usually takes about 45 min-1 hour, but the food is always still warm when I receive it.

data.title: Awesome!!!
data.text: We love this place!! Everything is perfect here... Very authentic and a hard working staff deliver an excellent meal each and every time, without fail!  I usually get a curry dish and friends and family members have tried it all.  We always leave very satisfied with both the outstanding service and awesome food.  Highly recommend!!

data.title: My Thai Favorite
data.text:
Don't judge by outside or that it's next door to a vet clinic, Lol
Very nice inside
They have the food dialed in !!

data.title: Team Party!!
data.text: This restaurant is good and the food is good. For the money we pay it is a good restaurant. Only reason i don't give it a 5 star is the waiting time is bad. If you don't have any time constraints you can visit this restaurant.

data.title: I heard all the hype, but I think it's just your average Thai restaurant especially for Des Moines
data.text: People have told me for years that this is their favorite place and I finally showed up with one of them to experience it first hand.  It was OK; the service was a little slow.  I was disappointed in my spicy calamari and shrimp entree, not from the seafood, but from the raw tomatoes and cucumbers that came with it.

data.title: The Best Thai in Iowa (so far)
data.text: They would deserve 4.5 stars if such a rating were possible. This is the best Thai food I've had since I left California a year ago. Highly recommended and I hope they continue to deliver outstanding tastes!

data.title: Big Fan of Thai Flavors
data.text: Great food.  The flavor palate and the heat level are just right.  I'm a big fan of the avocado curry and the pumpkin curry.  The wait can be long for lunch or for delivery, so get there early or order early.

data.title: New menu but "we don't have any of the items on this page or anything marked new"
data.text: I stopped for dinner just after the place opened on a Wednesday night. I was seated in a back dining room after walking by 8 or 10 people who may or may not work here but I felt out of place. I was seated and given two menus, one sushi and a dinner menu. Another staff member came over for my drink order. Then the guy who seated me came back and told me that anything marked "new" on the menu was not in stock yet and also anything on the "Chinese" page wasn't available. Well that was a good portion of the menu and all of the items that I had thought about having for dinner. Not impressed so I went elsewhere for my meal.

data.title: Best Thai Food I've had in a long time.
data.text:
The Massman Curry with pork is excellent and was the second time that I have had it. The Yellow Curry and Pad Thai are great also.
I would recommend getting the hot spice level at 1 so that you can experience the flavors better and not be overwelmed by hot pepper.

data.title: Good Thai food
data.text: I think Thai flavor is one of the best local Thai places to eat. They recently added sushi, which I tried and it was ok, good option, but I wouldn't go there if I just wanted sushi.

data.title: Excellent Food and Attentive Service
data.text:
I stopped here near the end of lunch service on a Wednesday and found it a pleasant surprise. It was quiet, past lunch peak, and a waitress quickly took my drink order and gave me a lunch menu. I settled on the red curry with calamari. They have a very funny scale for their levels of spice. It goes from 0 through 3 (Hot), then 4 for Very Hot, 5 for Thai Hot, and 6 for Iowa Hot. I assume that's meant ironically.

At any rate, other than wanting a few more squid in the mix, I was completely satisfied at level 4 with both the heat and the flavors. The portion was generous — too large for me to finish at lunch, but I nearly got to the bottom of it.

There is also a sushi bar for those so inclined, and all the staff seemed copacetic with each other as well as with the customers. I noticed them taking care of two gentlemen at a table near me, and they were meticulous about getting his special order right. I'd go back, maybe for dinner next time.

user_location.name: Las Vegas, New Mexico, United States

data.title: Best Thai in DSM
data.text: If anyone tells you to try the "other" popular Thai place in town, save a trip and go here instead. I got mine to go and it was everything I had hoped it would be.  Spice level was exactly to my liking and the flavors were fresh and on point.  I would recommend this to everyone.

data.title: Great Thai food
data.text: This is our go-to for take-out.  They have quick service, reasonable prices, and great-tasting Thai dishes.  I've never actually dined in the restaurant, but for take-out this is one of the best in Des Moines.

data.title: Thai "bland" Flavor
data.text: I'm sorry to rate this low, b/c the food was so plain and Americanized. The place name and their dish are opposite. I ordered, chicken cashew, and they didn't even stir fired that cashew in the dish, they just throw it on top like a topping, what a shame.

data.title: Excellent tasting food, but the wait can be long
data.text: Thai flavors has something for everyone- sushi, meat dishes, fish dishes, vegetarian dishes.  My favorite is the eggplant lunch with veggies.  A word of caution, go lower on the spice scale than you think you should.  I love spicy, Indian food, and a spice level of 2 is just perfect for me.  If you don't like spicy food at all- definitely stick with a 1.  My only complaint is that the service can be slow, so just make sure that you don't have a meeting scheduled for after lunch!

data.title: Great food all the time!
data.text: Every time I go there it's great food and great service whether it's take out or to eat in. It's great food and great service!
